snippet.title: Liquid injections for knee arthritis do not prove to be helpful in studies
snippet.description: Liquid injections called viscosupplementation don't seem effictive against osteoarthritis of the knee.

snippet.title: EVER WONDERED if cracking your knuckles is bad for you?
snippet.description: If you're a kid, chances are you either crack your knuckles or know someone who cracks theirs.

snippet.title: One Joint Shoulders a Heavy Load
snippet.description: I could blame the weightlifting -- the bench presses and overhead military lifts that put the shoulder under pressure. I could blame the arm-twisting I get three times a week from my aikido buddies (are you listening, Jean Luc?).

snippet.title: Mainstream Makes Adjustments
snippet.description: The sound of cavitation is music to my ears. That's the popping noise made when a joint is taken past its normal range of motion and a bubble of gas emerges in the surrounding synovial fluid. Keep twisting or pulling and eventually the bubble bursts, relieving pressure on the joint.

snippet.title: Rare Joint Cancer Yields Its Secrets
snippet.description: MONDAY, April 9 (HealthDay News) -- Researchers have found that synovial sarcoma, a rare cancer that affects the joints, actually starts with genetic changes that affect muscle cells.

snippet.title: Green Tea May Ease Rheumatoid Arthritis
snippet.description: MONDAY, April 30 (HealthDay News) -- Green tea, already touted for its cardiovascular and anticancer benefits, may also help ease the inflammation and pain of rheumatoid arthritis, a new study suggests.

snippet.title: Protein May Be Key to Rheumatoid Arthritis
snippet.description: WEDNESDAY, March 28 (HealthDay News) -- In the quest for the causes of and potential treatments for rheumatoid arthritis, Japanese researchers have identified a protein that could be a target for future therapy.
